intro: Hieracium nitens, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Hieracium nitens is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
